body: If the backend is not in high payload, check your firewall. gRPC connection is keeping alive as long as possible.

@hanahmily 6.3.1 is a new version, which has no Apache release, making this a bad idea. People may confuse, whether it is an Apache release image or not.

SkyWalking 6.4.0 will be shipped tomorrow, so let's move this to 6.4.0 only. Otherwise, you will need a release vote for your 6.3.1 image docker and script file.
Your removed all indexes but agent didn't reboot. So either you wait 10 mins to wait agent hot-reboot, or reboot the agent with service directly.
@hi-sb Welcome to be 155th contributor. Welcome to the SkyWalking contributor team.
resolve https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/3428
@zhaoyuguang Only put `resolve` in the first comment, auto closing will work. I just changed it. You could see it related now.

hi, After analysis further, I found some new  details.  before run oap server, I run “oapServiceInit.sh”  create index templates  in Es ,Except below indexes:
- register_lock
- endpoint_inventory
- service_instance_inventory
- network_address_inventory
- service_inventory
these indexes will be created in oap start process ,I guess  
but come to next day like I said, these indexes will be deleted  and can't  be created again util  I restart oap .
all problems of discussion maybe relate to this .

@wu-sheng , i find that when I start up the agent, this happens with great probability.Then I checked  the thread status on the OAP server and found that "grpcServerPool-1-thread" was all BLOCKED.I guess there are deadlocks between threads.

That is removed in 6.2.0. As far as i know.

@dmsolr Are you OK with this PR now?
English only, and yes, removed.
Trace id is only available when there is tracing context existing and agent has registered. If you are using a simple main, it doesn't work. SkyWalking is designed for server, meaning always standby.
You are using 6.x, so you should set port to grpc port. Look like you are not following our document.
This is not a setup issue, from the log, maybe some plugin is not supported yet. Maybe zuul or hystrix.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/64702503-87fd0b00-d45f-11e9-87f6-ff4fa05b666e.png)

It is already there, click the node inside red box.
Windows file system is different, you may be facing too long file path of git or file system. Check you log.
I am highly doubting this is a docker issue. UUID is not existing somehow.
Not today.
That is SLA top N in desc order. The backend has supported, UI doesn't include it. If you want to add, contribution is welcome.
In some envs, we noticed that. 6.4.0 should be released today, we fixed it.
Bulk mechanism should have upgraded in 6.3.0, very different to 6.1 and 6.2
All these indexes should not be delete even. These are metadata indexes.
Are you using the 6.3.0+ agent? The reboot doesn't exist before that.
it's ok!

You could send pull request directly.

> server

OK, do i need to comment the other version in testcases project ?
I guess, otherwise, it will break as last time we tried(right?)

I am sure my version is 6.3.0. agents won't re-register after "OutOfMemoryError" occurred in server, and I couldn't see the "cool down" in the logs. It still doent's re-register so far.   I am going to give it a try for the 6.4.0 version observing whether or not it still have the same problem.
What do you expect after `OutOfMemoryError`? This is hard to say. Re-register is not for this case.

The situation is when "OutOfMemoryError" occurred, I rebooted the server. I expect agents can re-gister by themselves without rebooting them, but it didn't work. maybe in "OutOfMemoryError" situation, re-register is not support. Am i meaning right?
That is no `re-register`, that should be called as `reconnect`, because you are talking about gRPC level connection. This has an issue in 6.3.0, YES. We have fixed it in 6.4.0 release.
I see, thank you so much. I'll give it a shot right way.
This is not a too long file path problem because I have fixed this problem before. anyway, I will use linux instead, thanks for the reply
Can you share you command line to start docker container? I didn't get any error when I run it. @itfinally
this issue is disappear when using a fresh ES. but if use an ES inited skywalking indexs, even if delete all that indexs it also error when oapServiceInit.sh
I don't have a clue, sorry.

> Just for reminder, it seems that there are pairs of async and sync methods in Cassandra, so please consider both of them when you intercept methods (consider whether they have async counterparts or not).
> 
> To name a few:
> 
> * `com.datastax.driver.core.Cluster#connect()` vs `com.datastax.driver.core.Cluster#connectAsync()`
> * `com.datastax.driver.core.SessionManager#execute` vs `com.datastax.driver.core.SessionManager#executeAsync`
> 
> > P.S. seems that the sync version simply calls the async version and wait for the result, so it should be able to just intercept the async version, maybe I'm wrong? Just a hint :)

exactly. sync version call async version and wait for results.
So you mean that only intercept async version is enough, right? 
there are 2 questions, as below
1. if i intercept both sync and async as EXIT SPAN what is going on in skywalking?
2. if i only intercept async version, there is a little bit confuse on UI. when user call sync version, but tracing on UI will display async version, is there a standard way to solve it?
thanks.

Sure, the command:
```yml
docker run \
  --network=host \
  --restart=always \
  --env-file /data/server/skywalking/oap_config.list \
  --name skywalking-oap \
  -d docker.io/apache/skywalking-oap-server
```

And `oap_config.list`:

```text
SW_CLUSTER=nacos
SW_SERVICE_NAME=itfinally.skywalking
SW_CLUSTER_NACOS_HOST_PORT=192.168.16.132:8848


SW_STORAGE=elasticsearch
#SW_NAMESPACE=skywalking
SW_STORAGE_ES_CLUSTER_NODES=192.168.16.132:9200
SW_STORAGE_ES_HTTP_PROTOCOL=http


SW_CONFIGURATION=nacos
SW_CONFIGURATION_NACO_SERVER_ADDR=192.168.16.132
SW_CONFIGURATION_NACO_PORT=8848
SW_CONFIGURATION_NACO_GROUP=skywalking
SW_CONFIGURATION_NACO_CLUSTER_NAME=default


SW_CORE_REST_HOST=0.0.0.0
SW_CORE_REST_PORT=12800
SW_CORE_REST_CONTEXT_PATH=/
SW_CORE_GRPC_HOST=0.0.0.0
SW_CORE_GRPC_PORT=11800
```

Emmm....   
Is the `latest` version is really is 6.3.0 version ?

> if i intercept both sync and async as EXIT SPAN what is going on in skywalking?

Depend on what kind of codes you are written, basically, override happens. If `sync` calls `async` then, span set as `sync` name. Otherwise, `async`. Does `async` interceptor need `#asyncFinish`?

> if i only intercept async version, there is a little bit confuse on UI. when user call sync version, but tracing on UI will display async version, is there a standard way to solve it?

If you only did this, you could just don't separate the `sync` and `async` in UI, then should be fine always. You could choose to do it separately or only `async`.

The bug should be fixed in 6.3.0, #3181 and #3240  @yefei14131

Segment is null, meaning, there is no tracing context, so span created. Do you check wich plugin should generate span? Please check our supported list, and make sure you have the plugins you need.
/run e2e
@wu-sheng question is error only if i use the agent of 6.4.0, it is always ok before that version.
`N/A` is not the error, it means no one created the span before you call`#getTraceId`, nothing more.

@wu-sheng i know, but still i don’t know why upgrade from 6.2.0/6.3.0 to 6.4.0 will cause that? Isn’t it should keep functionality consistently? or in another word “Backwards compatible”?
@wu-sheng currently we fully upgraded to 6.4.0. to make TraceContext.traceId() right, we revert the agent back to 6.3.0, but still this is very awkward.
Fixed in 6.4.0 release, we have made sure the endpoint wouldn't be too long.
Should have fixed in #3173
Since 6.3.0, automatically hot reboot supported.

> I thought this is instance level, for service. Look like more complex

I agree with you. And I will keep doing this now.

They you have to look up your server env. Something blocks, I can't be sure why. Most likely, your storage crashed or facing performance issue, then, the grpc can't write data to memory cache, which could trigger this issue.
What do you mean thread destoried?
from jvisualvm, can't find any thread named "grpc-default-executor-*", as if they have been destroied somehow. but another server still running ok has several "grpc-default-executor-*".
That is new to me. Could you find why? How to make grpc thread exit

strange thing is "grpc-default-executor-" is from the default thread pool in grpc, which use name in format of "grpc-default-executor-%d", but in 6.4.0, a ThreadPoolExecutor is set in GRPCServer "nettyServerBuilder...executor(executor)" with given threadPoolSize and queueSize, so it make no sense still using the default thread pool.
In 6.4.0, we use our own thread pool. Because in some cases, too many grpc thread created. That is expected.
Could you provide a UI screenshot for this?
